conbody.p: This activity allows groups of students to listen to a variety of audio sources, including external ones, teacher, or other student.
Select a group tab (see ) and then select the audio source ( ) to use for the listening activity.
Select External then select the corresponding audio hub input from the drop down list. Volume control slider for the selected external source is located immediately below the drop down list.
External sources will be indicated on the icons of students listening to this source ( ).

fig.title: Student icons: listening to an external source

image.alt: Student icons: listening to an external source

conbody.p: Select Teacher radio button to use teacher headset as the source for listening.
Teacher headset source will be indicated on the icons of the students listening to it ( ).

fig.title: Student icon: listening to the teacher

image.alt: Student icon: listening to the teacher

conbody.p: Teacher headset microphone can also be combined with an external source, e.g. to provide a commentary. Select Combined radio button and select an external source to be combined with teacher headset. Volume control slider for the selected external source is located immediately below the drop down list..
Combination of an external source with teacher will be indicated on the icons of students who have this as a listening source ( ).

fig.title: Student icon: listening to an external source combined with teacher

image.alt: Student icon: listening to an external source combined with teacher

conbody.p: Any student, even those who are not members of the group, can be selected as a source for listening. Select Student radio box and the select a student from drop down list to assign this student a a source for listening.
conbody.note: If this student is engaged in Pairs or Discussion, then all other students from the participating pair or group also become the source for listening.
conbody.p: Student source will be indicated on the icons of student listening to it ( ). Icon of a student who is the source will be marked with a sign matching color to the group which is listening to her or him.

fig.title: Student icon: listening to another student (left), student is a source for another group (right)

image.alt: Student icon: listening to another student (left), student is a source for another group (right)

conbody.note: A student can also be assigned as a source for listening by selecting Audio source for... from the student menu (see ).
conbody.p: A teacher can monitor the source for listening by pressing Monitor button in the Audio source selection panel.
Select None radio button to turn the source off and finish the listening activity.
